name: 1.0 - Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Survey Documentation
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings.
– all drawings are the latest revision.
Record of conformity - Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls being implemented, that is PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Check survey to be completed of all footing positions prior to placing any of the panels.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed Survey Report
1.4 - Submission & approval of precast shop drawings
○ Submit precast wall panel shop drawings to the principal’s representative for approval prior to fabrication commencement.
Reference Documents - ZULU-BECA- 001-SPC-00005, 0321 cl 1.16, Drawing 20003 note PC7
1.5 - Submission & approval of structural steel shop drawings
○ Submit structural steel shop drawings to the principal’s representative for approval prior to fabrication commencement.
○ Items to include but not limited to:
Reference Documents - ZULU-BECA- 001-SPC-00005 cl 1.16, Structural Drawing Set 030-20, AS/NZS 1252.2
Acceptance Criteria - Submission & approval of the following:
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Qualification Documents
1.8 - Temporary Works – Pre- Cast Concrete Panels
Acceptance Criteria - Submission and approval of the following documentation by the FH Temp Works Coordinator (not limited to):
– Certification of Ground Platform for Lift
Record of conformity - Certification of lifting points, propping plan, erection sequence, lift study, Geo Report
Acceptance Criteria - Submission and approval of the following documentation by the FH Temp Works Coordinator (not limited to):
– Certification of Ground Platform for Lift
Record of conformity - Certification of lifting points, erection sequence, lift study, Geo Report
Acceptance Criteria - Inspection of the following prior to casting:
— Connection materials and inserts in place
○ Inspection of the following after casting
— First precast element of each type at the earliest possible time before and immediately after stripping
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Element Casting Checklist
Acceptance Criteria - Complete inspection of precast panels whilst still loaded on the truck prior to accepting the delivery on site.
○ Identify any damage/defects prior to unloading of the material and correct panel being delivered as per the sequence.
○ Precast element identification is available on each panel
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Materials Inspection Checklist on Conqa
Acceptance Criteria - Complete Pre-Lift/s Commencement Checklist
○ Ensure erection drawings & propping plans available to the crew
Record of conformity - Pre-Lift/s Commencement Checklist, This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Levelling shims have been set correctly and gap between the footing & precast panel is not greater than 40mm
○ Survey to confirm panel placement as per the design
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
○ Propping plan is available for each precast panel
○ Ensure propping is installed as per engineer’s design and/or conforms to AS 3850.2 Sections 5
○ Inspection Notice provided for installed temporary bracing
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Building Engineering ITP
Responsibility - Site Engineer / Foreman / Principals Representative
Acceptance Criteria - Install all fixings as per the drawings & engineers plan

○ All welding shall be carried out in accordance with AS 1554.1 unless noted otherwise, all welds shall be 6 continuous fillet category SP using E49XX electrodes - butt welds shall be complete penetration butt welds, category SP.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed Welding Certificate
2.7 - Testing of Welding on Precast Elements (if required)
Acceptance Criteria - A competent inspector shall inspect welding works as per the below table or as otherwise stated by the engineer:
WELD TYPE || % OF WELDS TESTED || TESTING PROCEDURE
Record of conformity - This Signed ITP, Welding Test Certificate
Acceptance Criteria - Grout to be used shall be non-shrink and have a 28 day characteristic strength of 40 MPA. Details of the proposed grout used to be submitted to the engineer for approval.
○ Note: sealing of the panel vertical joints will be by the precast contractor.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Building Engineering ITP
2.9 - Removal of Props and Inspection of Completed Precast Walls
○ Inspection Notice provided of the final structure before removal of temporary bracing

○ All propping must remain in position until all structural elements (roof beams, bracing, struts and purlins) affecting stability are fully erected and braced, securely fixed to the panels and the panels have become an integral part of the structure. During construction the builder must ensure no panel props are disconnected by contractors other than the panel contractor.
○ No propping is to be removed without the written consent of the engineer
Reference Documents - Approved Shop Drawings, Drawing 20003
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Engineers Written Approval, Building Engineering ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Complete a materials inspection upon arrival of steel sections.
○ Ensure correct components and sections have been sent
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Building Engineering ITP, Materials Inspection Checklist on Conqa
Acceptance Criteria - Complete Pre-Lift/s Commencement Checklist
○ Lift sequence/arrangement of steel members available
○ Adequate fall protection in place eg guard rails, safety mesh
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Building Engineering ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Steel Members erected as per design layout and Steel Framing Schedule
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Building Engineering ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Unless otherwise noted, all bolts shall be M20 Grade 8.8/S, all H/D bolts shall be grade 4.6/S.
○ No connection shall have less than 2 bolts
○ Bolts to be installed as per manufacturer/engineer specification
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed

Acceptance Criteria - All welding shall be carried out in accordance with AS 1554.1 unless noted otherwise, all welds shall be 6 continuous fillet category SP using E49XX electrodes - butt welds shall be complete penetration butt welds, category SP.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed Welding Certificate
3.6 - Testing of Welding on Steel Framing
Acceptance Criteria - A competent inspector shall inspect welding works as per the below table:
WELD TYPE || % OF WELDS TESTED || TESTING PROCEDURE
Record of conformity - This Signed ITP, Welding Test Certificate
○ Provide notice for an inspection of the Steel Framing erected on site before installation of roofing sheets/lining.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Building Engineering Structural Steel ITP
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
